document.docAuthor: Simaiakis, Stylianos Michail, Akkari, Nesrine & Zapparoli, Marzio
document.masterDocTitle: The centipedes of Peloponnisos and first records of genus Eurygeophilus in the East Mediterranean (Myriapoda: Chilopoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The centipedes of Peloponnisos and first records of genus Eurygeophilus in the East Mediterranean (Myriapoda: Chilopoda)

subSubSection.paragraph:
( 8 )
Henia illyrica Mein.
[sic!]: Attems, l 929 b: 464 .

( 9 )
Chaetechelyne montana Mein.
: Attems, l 929 c: 299 .

General distribution. Europe: Albania , Austria , Bulgaria , Bosnia Herzegovina , Croatia , Czech Republic , FYR Macedonia , Germany , Greece (incl. Ionian Is.), Hungary , Italy , Poland , Romania , Serbia , Slovakia , Slovenia . West Asia: Caucasus, Turkey (
Zapparoli 2002
; Minelli et al. 2006 ).

New records from Mt. Parnonas (
Fig. 11
). 1 ex., Arkadia, Sitaina to Platanos, close to Panagia church (loc. 7 ), 770 m ,
N 37.301359
/
E 22.658826
,
27 Oct. 2014
; 3 exx., Arkadia, Agios Ioannis Theologos church, mountain refuge (loc. 19 ), 1610 m ,
N 37.226653
/
E 22.591896
,
29 Oct. 2014
; 2 exx., Arkadia, Kastanitsa to Parnonas refuge, crossroad to Agios Vasileios (loc. 21 ), 1560 m ,

.

Ecological notes. 0–2400 m ; in
Carpinus
woods, in
Platanus orientalis
riparian woods, in
Abies cephalonica
,
Pinus nigra
and
Fagus sylvatica
woods, and in agroecosystems (
Dobroruka 1965
; Zapparoli 1996 , 2002 ).

Remarks. The old records of
Chaetechelyne vesuviana
Newport, 1845
, and
C. montana (Meinert, 1870 )
from Peloponnisos, published by
Daday ( 1889 )
, are assigned to this species (
Zapparoli 2002
).
